data.title: Bytes
data.text:
Advertisment

New Offerings from Sybase 365

Sybase 365, a subsidiary of Sybase Inc, launched its new multimedia content

delivery gateway and a new suite of products for the financial industry. The

multimedia content delivery gateway, MMS 365, sends and receives MMS from

multiple sources.

MMS 365 runs on the Sybase 365 operator-grade network and

supports all popular rich content including photos, graphics, audio, video,

alerts, ringtones, and wallpaper. It enables content providers, marketers, and

media companies to deliver MMS content directly to consumers handsets

globally, with a single connection. According to Marty Beard, president of

Sybase 365, "MMS is, and will continue to be, the most viable method for

delivering rich media. Mobile campaigns are becoming an increasingly important

part of a companys communication and advertising strategy."

Sybase mBanking 365 provides secure and direct multi-channel

interaction with customers over all mobile messaging channelsSMS, WAP, and

rich client. Services like bank account activity alerts that notify customers of

potentially fraudulent transactions in real time as well as activities like

balance inquiries can be conducted conveniently and without involving costly

customer care resources.

Advertisment

Now, HDTV on Handsets

Texas Instruments has announced that it has developed OMAP, an

application-processing engine that enables mobile phone users to get

high-definition TV on their handset. They would also have 8 mega pixel cameras

on handset enabling camcorder facility. The enhanced services through 2.5 and

2.75 G networks would make the public used to richer customer experience and

prepare it to move to 3G. New gateways for these can be installed right away to

provide such services.

Advertisment

Mundu Radio Gets Symbian Signed Status

Geodesic Information Systems announced the Symbian Signed status for its

Mundu Radio. Receiving this status now allows Mundu Radio to support all the

latest and popular Nokia Smartphones being sold in the market. The Nokia phone

users can download Mundu Radio at http://radio.mundu.com. Symbian signed is an

industry endorsed application signing program recognized by major phone

manufacturers and mobile operators worldwide. Users of the latest Nokia N-series

and E-series phones can now download Mundu Radio to gain personalized access to

thousands of Internet Radio stations from around the world and the broadest

array of music and other content. Further, existing users of Mundu Radio can now

upgrade to the latest Nokia phones and continue to tune in on the move.

According to Atul Chitnis, senior VP, Products & Strategy,

Geodesic, "The Symbian signed status reinforces Mundu Radio as the

best-in-breed product. It allows us to extend Mundu Radio to the large worldwide

mobile user base using Nokia phones based on the popular S60 third edition

platform. We are pleased to better respond to our customers needs by

providing them with a highly reliable and high-quality product that follows

industry standards for reliability and security."

Advertisment

More Intelligent Mobile

India Digital Life Style Distributors (IDLDPL) announces the introduction

of ASUS P525 quad-band PDA phone in India, a powerful and intelligent

mobile solution for the executives. This phone incorporates push email,

Wi-Fi support and a built-in numeric keypad to deliver a complete mobile

business solution. Users can now stay connected, no matter where they are,

and accomplish the applications. The P525 leverages push email functions

to deliver real-time synchronization with email, phonebooks and calendar

items as changes occur on the exchange account through continuous

connection with a mobile operator between the P525 and a server.

Wireless-G Router from

Netgear

Netgear Technologies India, a worldwide provider of technologically

advanced branded networking products, brings the NETGEAR Wireless-G Router

(WGR614)excellent for surfing the Internet, email and online chat for

home and office. It has great performance with dual antenna. It is also a

simple and secure way to share your high-speed Internet connection across

5-10 users without any compromise on speed. WGR614 provides an excellent

speed of up to 54Mbps and support 802.11g protocol. This broadband router

with 4-ports is configurable for private networks and public hotspots and

also has an inbuilt double firewall protection from external hackers

attacks.

Wireless Traffic Monitoring

ProCurve Networking, a business unit of HP providing enterprise networking

solutions, has announced the implementation of sFlow technology for

wireless network access. It targets to provide customers with increased

visibility into wireless network traffic.

ProCurve and InMon

jointly developed the wireless extensions for sFlow, an industry-standard

technology that uses packet-based traffic sampling to provide network-wide

visibility.

By integrating sFlow with

the ProCurve Wireless Edge Services xl Module, ProCurve is bolstering its

strategy for the unification of wired and wireless infrastructure.

Customers will be able to use wireless sFlow to assist in wireless

deployment, troubleshooting wireless signal or performance issues, as well

as gaining visibility into network traffic such as top talkers, top

applications and connections. When combined with a management application

such as ProCurve Manager software, sFlow will also give customers

pervasive, unified wired and wireless network visibility and control.

According to Paul Congdon,

CTO, ProCurve Networking by HP, "By including sFlow technology in our

wireless platform, we are making it easier for enterprises to monitor

network devices, enforce security and analyze traffic flows across both a

wired and wireless infrastructure,"

According to Peter Phaal,

president, InMon, "Wireless networks have traditionally been

difficult to monitor and manage. sFlow for wireless gives visibility into

how and where the wireless network is being used, enabling targeted

control actions."

Lenovos New Budget Notebooks

Lenovo has introduced its new range of budget notebooks under the G Series

starting at Rs 31,750. The range is targeted at value-conscious consumers who

are looking to make a transition from desktops to notebooks.

Advertisment

The G400 features Intels Pentium Dual-Core T2080 (1.73GHz,

533MHz FSB, 1MB) processor and comes with a 14.1" WXGA high definition

glossy widescreen display, in a silver cover. Operating on DOS, the notebooks

are equipped with Lenovos high touch full-sized keyboard and trademark one

key recovery, which allows users to easily recover data in the event of a crash.

The G400 is fully loaded with features including a 4-in-1 memory

card reader, a high-speed 56K modem, wireless technology of Lenovo 802.11 bg and

integrated Bluetooth v2.0. G400 is light weight (2.35kg) and has a battery life

of up to four hours with a pre-loaded energy cut 2.1 software for effective

power management.

Communication and entertainment features include an integrated

microphone, Realtek high definition audio with greater than 8cc chamber design

for impeccable sound, and limited edition Power2Go 5.5 multimedia software that

allows the user to record various forms of data.

Advertisment

According to Anil Philip, executive director, Transaction

Business, Lenovo India, "Notebooks offering mobility and productivity at an

affordable price are becoming a preferred choice for consumers looking to

upgrade from desktops to notebooks. With the Lenovo 3000 G Series, we are

targeting a new set of value-conscious consumers and providing them one of our

best engineered notebooks."

Google SMS in India

Google has announced the launch of Google SMS for mobile users in India.

This beta offering brings the power of Google Search to the users fingertips,

making information available on the move, without the need of a computer or an

Internet-enabled phone. With Google SMS mobile messaging service, users can get

business listings, movie show times and more, simply by sending a text message

to the shortcode 54664 <5GOOG> from their mobile phones. This service is

currently available on the Airtel, Aircel, BPL, BSNL and Reliance networks, and

has relevant local data for mobile users in Bangalore, Delhi, Hyderabad, and

Mumbai.

Advertisment

Delhi to go Wi-Fi

New Delhi will soon join Bangalore and Pune on the Wi-Fi meshed network,

with the Delhi government planning to install Wi-Fi zones in the national

capital. Wi-Fi zones are to be established through private-public partnership

(PPP) model. Initially, the government of NCT, Delhi, has notified three hot

zones for Wi-Fi access coverage. The private partner will be entrusted with

designing, implementing and operating the Internet access using Wi-Fi Hot Zone

Outdoor Infrastructure, and to provide high speed wireless Internet access to

citizens and tourists.
